alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 25 at 4:44AM CDT until April 25 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .The combination of snow melt and rainfall has resulted minor flooding along the Yellow River at Necedah. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...The combination of snow melt and rainfall has resulted minor flooding along the Yellow River at Necedah. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM CDT Monday was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is near flood stage. It will then fall below flood stage early this morning to 14.6 feet this morning. It will rise to 14.8 feet this evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.7 feet on 05/10/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued by 11 am today.
